idiom: Да направиш две краеви да се сретнат
example: After losing his job, he found it hard to make two ends meet.

figurative_meaning: Wishing someone success, especially before a performance.
example: Break a leg before your performance tonight; I know you'll do great!

figurative_meaning: Loyalty and support regardless of circumstances.
example: They have been friends through thick and thin for over a decade.

idiom: Да ја пуштиш мачката од вреќата
literal_meaning: Let the cat out of the bag.
example: She let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.

figurative_meaning: A major problem that people avoid discussing.
example: We need to address the elephant in the room regarding our budget cuts.

literal_meaning: Hit the nail on the head.
figurative_meaning: Getting something exactly right or identifying the core issue.
example: You really hit the nail on the head with your analysis of the situation.
The exam was a piece of cake; I finished it in half an hour.
I think I’ll stay home today; I’m feeling a bit under the weather.

figurative_meaning: Staying up late to work or study.
example: She had to burn the midnight oil to finish her project on time.

idiom: Затворен помеѓу камен и тешко место
literal_meaning: Caught between a rock and a hard place.
example: I felt caught between a rock and a hard place when I had to choose between my job and family responsibilities.
I didn’t want to go to the dentist, but I had to bite the bullet and make an appointment.

figurative_meaning: In a state of bliss or extreme happiness.
example: She was on cloud nine after receiving her acceptance letter from her dream university.
If you don't apply for that job soon, you might miss the boat.
His business went down in flames after just one year.

literal_meaning: Take it with a pinch of salt.
example: When he tells stories, I always take them with a pinch of salt.

figurative_meaning: Describes an irritating person or situation.
example: My neighbor is such a pain in the neck; he complains about everything.

idiom: Најдоброто нешто откако е исечен леб.
literal_meaning: The best thing since sliced bread.
example: This new app is truly the best thing since sliced bread!
Before you judge her, try to walk in someone else's shoes.

figurative_meaning: Initiating conversation in a social setting.
example: He told a joke to break the ice at the party.
